query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: Synthesis paper on impact assessments of FMM
result.description:
The work will assess the value, impact, and trade-offs of the projected uptake of the alternative FMMs in T2.3 across the ALTERFOR countries and sectors potentially impacted. The cross sectorial and cross national implications of adaptation will be assessed to the year 2100, and for each of the prospective scenarios as developed in T2.1.
The outcome of the assessment will be documented in 3 scientific papers and synthesized in a report.

result.description: This series of deliverables will explain the communication and dissemination activities followed during the reporting periods as well as the results from these activities and will update projects dissemination and communication plans respectively. The report will include a section covering dissemination strategy under a more commercial or marketing oriented perspective. Yearly reports will also contain a section with updates about all events organized and conducted.

result.title: GSM-R or LTE radio, Design solution
result.description: GSM-R or LTE radio, Design solution, based on tests results of previous and ongoing projects and on Bombardier TU architecture. From the best trains configurations adapted to the market involving TU and DPS, taking into account the characteristics of the locomotives of the CFM partners a GSM-R or LTE radio solution is designed to be integrated in the TU and DPS to safely transfer all necessary orders and information (to and from) in nominal mode and degraded mode in all operational situations that may be encountered in the network.

result.title: Conference proceedings
result.description: In close cooperation with WP4, a final conference will be organized in one of the participating countries. It will serve as a platform for dialogue and knowledge exchange, triggered by the research results. Discussions and conclusions from the conference will be spread via various channels (project website, project diary, online platforms of organizations related to national forest management context and EU R&I platforms) and instruments (publications, press release, newsletter etc.).

result.title: TrainDy, Sensitivity analysis report
result.description: Explains the methodology followed to execute a sensitivity analysis with TrainDy and the way the relative approach is applied considering the track. It aims to reduce the number of parameters that have to be characterized statistically and to couple the position of the maximum LCF with the track. It results in a list of parameters and in a methodology to couple the position of maximum LCF with the occurrence of a track curve

result.title: LTD simulations report
result.description: D3.1 covers the simulations of different train families having different train length/hauled mass versus the technology implemented. For technology, it is not only meant the characteristic of GSM-R communication, but also the brake position, the number of TU and the occurrence of two axle wagons. It is the basis from which the two technical demonstrators are chosen.

result.title: Ready to implement, supported coordination mechanism
result.description:
Providing a full description of the coordination mechanism including the Terms of Reference, a joint vision of transport infrastructure capabilities and corresponding focus areas for innovation, a concerted rolling portfolio of relevant innovation programmes and initiatives until 2025 and 2030, key coordination structures and instruments such as on gate reviewing process and measures to drive professional competence building.
Deliverable refers to Task 1.4.

result.title: Report on the construction of the theoretical model of SODIS
result.description: Deliverable will be in the form of a report describing the theoretical model of SODIS inactivation to include a dynamic model of predicting efficacy of SODIS under the influence of dose at different solar irradiance ranges, for pathogenic surrogate species. The model will include regrowth risks associated with SODIS. TRL 4 This is the output of Tasks 4.1.1, 4.1.2
